name: ArchiveFiles
description: Archive files using a variety of compression formats such as .7z, .rar, .tar.gz, and .zip.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: rootFolder
inputs.label: Root folder (or file) to archive
inputs.helpMarkDown: The root folder to add to the archive.  Everything under this folder will be added to the resulting archive.

inputs.name: includeRootFolder
inputs.label: Include root folder archive paths
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the root folder will be included in all filepaths within the archive, otherwise all file paths will start one level lower.  For example, if the selected Root Folder is '/home/user/output/classes/', and contained 'com/acme/Main.class', the resulting archive would contain 'classes/com/acme/Main.class' if the root folder is included, or 'com/acme/Main.class', if the root folder is not included.

inputs.name: archiveType
inputs.label: Archive type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the compression scheme used.  To create a 'foo.jar', for example, choose the 'zip' for the compression, and specify 'foo.jar' as the archive file to create.  For all tar files (including compressed ones), choose 'tar'.

inputs.name: tarCompression
inputs.label: Tar compression
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally choose compression scheme, or choose 'none' to create an uncompressed tar file.

inputs.name: archiveFile
inputs.label: Archive file to create
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the name of the archive file to create.  For example to create 'foo.tgz', select the 'tar' Archive type, 'gz' for Tar compression.

inputs.name: replaceExistingArchive
inputs.label: Replace existing archive
inputs.helpMarkDown: If an existing archive exists, specify whether to overwrite it.  Otherwise files will be added to it.
